These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented. REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) DOJ-OGR-00026467

text_blocks.content: MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT 30 MINUTE CHECK SHEET ZA TIER G DATE: 08/04/2019
Various times and numbers throughout the table

A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented.
MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT

additional_notes: The document contains handwritten times and numbers in a table format, with some redactions marked as (b)(6); (b)(7)(C). The document is stamped with 'MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT' at the top and bottom.
